result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah N Gehring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month with payment plan fee of $15.00 to commence 3/15/2016. Alternate 35 days jail.
DNA costs to be paid along with fine on payment plan.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sarah N Gehring in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Jayne Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine $1523.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to pay $100.00 a month commencing 03/15/2016 or alternate of 35 days jail.
Treatment letters filed by Attorney Kershek

Defendant Sarah N Gehring in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has paid partial restitution and needs time to pay the balance. Court grants the request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Sarah N Gehring in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Sarah N Gehring in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting adjournment, as of right now there is no offer and he would like to speak with the DA assigned to the case. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
